name: Software Engineer - Fullstack
desc:
Company Description

Vlocity is a fast-growing enterprise applications company focused on bringing industry-specific business processes to the cloud. With 300 employees around the world and customers on six continents, Vlocity has been the fastest-growing independent software vendor on the Salesforce platform for two years running. Vlocity is currently shipping version 15 of its application suite, and has raised over $100MM in capital from investors including Salesforce.com, Accenture and Sutter Hill Ventures.

Vlocity develops software to help communications, media & energy providers, insurance carriers and government agencies digitally engage customers through their channels and devices of choice. We serve dozens of the world’s Fortune 5000 companies including Sky Italia, Telecom Italia, TELUS, 3, Telecom Argentina, Cellcom, New York Life, Farmers Insurance, Harvard Pilgrim, and Anthem. Our solutions run on our customers’ web sites, in their contact centers and on the mobile devices of their service and sales professionals – providing a compelling, modern, omnichannel experience. Despite the complexity and sophistication of the enterprise business processes we enable, we believe the user experience should be as simple and compelling as a consumer application.

Job Description

Vlocity, Inc. is recruiting full stack application developers to join our fast growing startup. These developers will have the unique opportunity to shape and create Vlocity's vertical apps from the ground up built on the Salesforce Platform.

As an early developer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing product requirements that are highly usable, scalable, extensible, and maintainable, in large part on the Force.com platform. You will work in a highly agile environment, with product managers, engineers and customers, as well as with our leadership team, using iterative and test-driven design methods. You will be developing modern, web-based applications for the Salesforce1 Platform using Visualforce, Apex, Javascript, HTML/CSS, and other technologies. An understanding of relational & NoSql databases is a plus.

We are going to build our industry apps on modern technology stacks. Force.com and Salesforce1 will be our cloud-based CRM platform. We will add additional technology stacks as needed and you'll be part of that analysis and development process.

Responsibilities

● Design and develop products in Visualforce, Apex, SalesForce1, Javascript, HTML/CSS, and related technologies.

● Object and entity modelling on Force.com platform.

● Write create clean, effective code for simple or complex user tasks.

● Work in an agile, rapid development and prototyping environment where effective communication is paramount.

● Contribute to building a positive, can-do, high-performance culture.

Experience

● 3+ years of product development experience.

● Experience with the Spring framework, JDBC, Maven and other Java related technologies.

● Excellent understanding of object-oriented design patterns & experience with OO languages (Java, Ruby, Python, Scala etc).

● Excellent Data Structure and Algorithms experience.

● Experience building web-based user interfaces, with a deep understanding of HTML, Javascript, and CSS.

● Experience with and knowledge of relational databases.

● Familiarity with JavaScript libraries such as jQuery, AngularJS, Backbone.

● Experience and desire to work within a fast-paced, iterative development environment;

● Experience with Agile development is a strong plus.

● Experience with Force.com and the SalesForce1 platform is a plus.

● Stellar academic background, Bachelor degree or equivalent experience required, specializing in computer science or similar engineering discipline.
subjects: Computer Science, Web Development, Data & Analytics, Mobile Apps, Databases, Software Testing, Communications, Web Design, Software Engineering, User Experience, Leadership, Management, Productivity, Media, Production, Sales, Industry, Salesforce

name: Software Engineer
desc:
SUMMARY - Software Engineer The Software Engineer's primary responsibility is to develop new and upgrade existing internal programs and software that help facilitate the device testing and inventory processes. This role will also include some web development tasks including working with APIs from various companies (including but not limited to eBay, Amazon, USPS, FedEx, etc.) to integrate our internal systems with theirs. Currently, the devices we handle are consumer electronics (including but not limited to phones, iPads, and other such gadgets) so basic knowledge of these items is required, though this list may expand in the future. This position works under general supervision and interacts with upper management daily.

Please note, we are looking for in-house development, not remote. Candidates will need to be local to us in Eden Prairie, MN

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop new and upgrade existing software to facilitate testing and inventory control processes, seeking to automate as many tasks as possible for the team.
  • Analyze existing code base to ensure optimal language(s) are used, potentially converting existing code to a different language.
  • Work with upper management to address bugs, issues, or other such problems as they arise.
  • Pivot between multiple different projects as needed, taking lead on each one.
  • Assist with development of website and backend integrations.
  • Develop tools for Android and iOS platforms that achieve the above.
  • Communicate all issues to upper management that could result in process delays, safety issues, or otherwise cause a loss to the company or its associates.
  • Work closely with other team members of all departments to ensure that all software needs are met.

BASIC & PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must be at least 18 years of age.
  • Previous software development experience required.
  • Working knowledge of programming languages, primarily: Ruby, JavaScript, Node.JS, Swift, MySQL/NoSQL Databases — languages may also include Java and Rails. Note that you will not necessarily need to learn all of these together, but the ability to create and edit code is the requirement and known languages can be addressed in the interview process.
  • Knowledge of Excel a plus, but not required.
  • Previous experience with mobile device testing or refurbishment preferred.
  • Working knowledge of mobile operating systems (Android, iOS, Windows, etc.) and their development languages highly preferred.
  • High school diploma or GED required, college preferred.
  • Must be available to work for extended periods during high volume periods (up to 8 hours per day, with possibility of weekend shifts) or to address "business critical" issues.
  • Experience with aforementioned APIs (eBay, Amazon, USPS, FedEx) is ideal.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, JOB SKILLS, & ABILITIES

  • Ability to communicate effectively with others using spoken and written English.
  • Ability to work under demanding time constraints and production goals.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and shift task priorities if necessary.

Salary will be based on experience, competence, and proven efficiency.
subjects: Web Development, Programming Languages, Operating Systems, Project Management, Databases, Software Testing, Development Tools, Communications, Software Engineering, Management, Productivity, Production, English, Test Taking Skills, Operations, Other Programming

name: Backend Web Developer (Node)
desc:
Who We Are

ScaleLab is a leading digital talent network on a mission to help online influencers expand their audience and overall career through technology and top-level agency services. We represent thousands of established social media stars and pride ourselves on providing each of them with the tools, support, community and resources they need to grow on and beyond the digital platforms they’ve mastered. Developing cutting-edge technology that utilizes years of industry experience combined with the enormous amounts of data provided by our large client-base is the core of the future of our company. This is where you come in!

Who are we looking for

Are you a type of person who loves to dive into a new technology stack? Are you self-motivated to explore and embrace new trends, routines, and technology? Do you love to work in a small and productive team?

We are looking for an experienced, LA-based Backend Engineer who will play a key role in ScaleLab’s vision for an integrated experience for brands and influencers. You will be a part of a small, highly-collaborative engineering team building a new product that’s meant to revolutionize the influencer marketing industry.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of back end development (Node)
  • Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills, motivation, and passion
  • Expert level ES6/7 JavaScript with Koa/Express frameworks
  • Practical experience building and consuming RESTful APIs
  • Strong knowledge of SOLID (object-oriented design), and Object-relational mapping
  • Experience in SOA (Service-oriented architecture)
  • Strong MySQL knowledge (table design, complex query creation, best practices)
  • Solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, cookies, asset loading, caching, REST)
  • Solid fundamental understanding of testing (including stubbing, functional, unit, and e2e)
  • Experience using CI/CD tools and systems such as Jenkins, Hudson, GitLab, GitHub, etc.
  • Experience with Websockets is a plus

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain various backend APIs using Node and Koa
  • Write and maintain clean, well-written, test-driven JavaScript code and documentation conforming to standards
  • Troubleshoot, identify and resolve API performance problems
  • Optimize database schema, queries, and caching
  • Collaborate with peers on best practices and promote knowledge sharing
  • Release early, release often
subjects: Web Development, Data & Analytics, Network & Security, Databases, Development Tools, Web Design, Social Media Marketing, Digital Marketing, Influence, Marketing Fundamentals, Motivation, Productivity, Career Development, Design Tools, Branding, Media, Production, Architectural Design, Industry, Product Marketing, Design Thinking, Personal Brand Building

name: PHP Full Stack Developer
desc:
Want to work for one of the fastest growing tech companies in the U.S.? Budget Dumpster, a fast-growing technology, digital marketing and sales organization in Westlake, Ohio is seeking a motivated Full Stack Developer to work on new and existing internal applications.

This is a new software development role and the ideal Full Stack candidate will be responsible for building and maintaining internal applications, mission critical Web APIs and eCommerce initiatives. The right candidate will be able to demonstrate practical experience with Object Oriented PHP, JavaScript, semantic HTML, CSS, and have familiarity with LAMP and/or LEMP stack.

This position reports directly to the Director of Web Development, and will work with a team of developers and marketers. This person will play a key role in developing and implementing impactful technology to elevate Budget Dumpster in the waste service industry.

Salary will be commensurate with experience.

Who we are

Based in Westlake, Ohio with a growing team of over 100 employees, Budget Dumpster has been recognized as a Cleveland Technology Award honoree (2017), one of America’s fastest growing tech companies by Deloitte (2016), one of the fastest-growing private companies by the Inc. 5000 (2017, 2016, 2015), one of the top fastest-growing companies in Northeast Ohio by Crain’s (2017, 2016, 2015), and top workplace by The Plain Dealer (2017, 2016, 2015).

In addition, our co-founders were named Entrepreneurs of the Year by EY (2016) and received the Inspiring Scaleup CEO Award from JumpStart (2016).

Here’s what an ordinary day of work might look like

  • Work with a talented team of passionate developers
  • Make an immediate impact with code, collaboration and provide creative solutions
  • Collaborate with our development team to implement marketing and strategic technology features
  • Opportunity to increase business knowledge and integrate with cross-functional teams
  • Build and implement strategic internal applications that align with core business initiatives
  • Refactor and maintain a proprietary content management system that will scale digital marketing efforts
  • Develop software to help improve our client and vendor experiences

This job is for you if

  • You are ambitious and passionate about technology
  • You love authoring new code, trouble shooting and mentoring team members
  • You have intimate knowledge of large PHP application and frameworks with a focus on performance
  • You appreciate the design and user-experience of products
  • You collaborate well with cross-functional teams and are excited by the chance to learn from others

And you’re comfortable with our technology

  • HTML / CSS
  • Sass, Gulp, Webpack, NPM, Babel, Jasmine, Karma
  • JavaScript (ECMAScript 5.1 and up) / jQuery (version 3 and up)
  • Vue.js, AngularJS, Foundation, Bootstrap
  • Web Sockets
  • PHP 5 – 7, PHPUnit
  • MySQL
  • LAMP (Ubuntu)
  • Laravel, SlimPHP, Composer
  • Git, Github
  • CMS experience

Budget Dumpster is able to provide the right candidate with a casual, open work environment, opportunities to learn and grow technical skills, and offers health (including vision and dental) insurance, Paid Time Off, 401K, Life Insurance, Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability and a number of company events throughout the course of the year. If you're looking for an opportunity to be challenged, to learn and grow your technical skills, and to have an immediate impact on high ranking websites and mission critical applications; please send your resumé and any code examples or project URLs to careers@budgetdumpster.com
subjects: Web Development, Project Management, Web Design, Digital Marketing, User Experience, Creativity, Management, Motivation, Content Marketing, Productivity, Production, Sales, Industry, Product Marketing

name: Full-Stack Engineer
desc:
Interested in contributing across the complete stack on a system that will transform how user data will be managed for every consumer app across the web?

We're looking for a seasoned full-stack engineer who has ideally worked in both small scrappy teams, as well as larger structured team. Someone who is comfortable up and down the stack and has the ability to own features.

We look for self-starters and an entrepreneurial mentality. We ship every week. You should be someone that likes to ship and can work with our entire stack - Python, Javascript(multiple frameworks), Flask.

The role: Work with our product, design, and engineering teams to understand experiences and goals and execute world-class code.

Your background

  • A full-stack generalist with deep experience building web applications
  • Comfortable working with everything from CSS to API’s
  • You’ve built and managed a large scale code base
  • Self starter with an entrepreneurial mindset and a passion for excellence
  • Ability to excel in a distributed team
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

Big Plus:

  • Open source experience
  • Blockchain experience: Solidity Smart Contracts, IPFS: the more experience the better.

Benefits:

Token package: you will receive tokens as a part of your comp package.

Remote: we are headquartered in San Francisco, but the majority of our team is remote. Whether in SF or not, you will have the opportunity to work the majority of your week in a remote capacity.

Following: dock.io has one of the largest and fastest growing communities in crypto, as well as an "alpha" app, which is growing by more than 3,000 new registered users per day.

Company retreat: annual team retreat in an international location.

name: Senior Full - Stack Engineer
desc:
A bit about us:

Devoted Health is a new health care company looking to improve the lives of seniors in America. We are guided by a deep belief that every senior should be treated like we would treat our own family members: with loving care and a profound commitment to their health and well-being. With aging demographics and rising health costs, this is an industry and problem space that needs today’s best talent working on solutions with high integrity and a long term view. We will improve the lives of seniors by helping them navigate the health care system, by utilizing world-class technology and data to enable a simplified experience, by partnering with top providers for better health outcomes. We are building a stellar team to drive towards our starting point goal to launch a Medicare Advantage plan and clinical services in 2019.

Why Devoted:

Make a difference... a big difference. You will have the opportunity, in a unique and dynamic culture, to be a part of something incredibly meaningful. We’re a disruptive startup with an inspiring mission. Learn and grow alongside our world-class team of health care, technology, and data leaders, dedicated to building a health plan and clinical services that care for everyone like they were our own mothers or fathers. Our team and board members have decades of experience in health care entrepreneurship, data, technology, services, and policy. With their support, we look forward to building a health plan and clinical services that will give seniors easy access to the high-quality care they deserve.

A bit more about this role:

Technology does amazing things in our daily lives, yet often is a source of pain and confusion within health care. We want to empower Devoted to deliver a world-class member experience with simple, flexible technical systems. If we need to delve into the murky underbelly of health care IT to do that, we’re up for the challenge.

Our north star is not a specific technology, but rather the goal of continually increasing the leverage of every member of the team. We’re currently building with Go, PostgreSQL, gRPC, GraphQL, React, TypeScript, Terraform, and AWS, and we think it’s a pretty awesome stack.

We want engineer-owners with the judgment to simultaneously solve for short and long-term business value. We’re looking for folks who have worked in complex domains and systems, and come through it with some wisdom but most importantly humility. We want people who are passionate about building great technology to solve problems for users—our members, our colleagues, and ourselves.

Whether you have a health care background or not, we are excited to learn from and share knowledge with you. Our engineering leadership team includes seasoned alumni of health care and technology organizations spanning the public and private sector. Our co-founders deeply understand and care about good technology: Todd Park co-founded Athenahealth, a multi-billion-dollar health care technology company, and served as CTO of the U.S.; Ed Park was Athenahealth's founding engineer and served as its CTO, COO, and President of Services.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Building product features across a range of technologies
  • Working with subject matter experts to understand and design solutions to improve our members lives
  • Working with other members of the technology team to improve our technology platform

Attributes to success:

  • Experience coupled with a willingness to learn new things
  • Comfort with uncertainty and a desire to be close to business problems
  • Desire to contribute individually, with the ability both to self-direct work and to collaborate with others on the technology team
  • Understanding of many technologies down to first principles, and a desire to add more to the list

Desired skills and experience:

  • 5+ years working as an individual technical contributor
  • Experience with our specific stack components a bonus but not required
  • Bonus: Prior backgrounds in product management, UX or data science; we often ask folks to wear more than one hat

If you love running towards complex challenges and transforming them into solutions, if you want to make a potentially huge impact on many lives, and if you are looking for a disruptive startup with an inspiring and talented team, Devoted Health may be the place for you.
subjects: Data & Analytics, Entrepreneurship, User Experience, Leadership, Management, Productivity, Production, Industry, Design Thinking

name: Senior Software Architect
desc:
About Bites:

Bites is an education technology company focused on personalized learning both within the news and traditional classroom instructional cycle. Through its two product offerings, Bites Media and Bites Labs, the company seeks to penetrate with offerings that complement each other from initial development to market offering.

Bites is searching far and wide for an awesome Lead Software Engineer! Based in Venice, Bites is a seed funded startup that focuses on personalized learning platforms — transforming the way teachers engage and support their students. You will be building out the architecture for our product offerings and helping to build a scalable team.

If that sounds like you, we'd love to talk to you!

Responsibilities: Design and code innovative, scalable and robust features on both the backend and the web application layers. Participate in all aspects of the project lifecycle, from ideation to specification to release. Collaborate closely with small, nimble, cross-functional teams, product managers and designers.

Requirements: A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related degree. 4+ years hands on experience in full-stack software development and architecture. Prior management/mentorship experience. Significant experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Python, Ruby, C#, PHP or Javascript. Strong experience designing and working with relational databases (/MySQL/MSSQL). Proficient front-end web development skills -- HTML/CSS/JS. Strong experience building high scale and high performance applications. DevOps experience building reliable applications through automated testing, continuous integration, monitoring, and analytics. A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms, and deftness at object-oriented design and systems architecture.

Leadership skills: Have an ownership mentality. Experienced as technical lead on a project. Demonstrated experience mentoring other engineers. Provide full-stack expertise to the engineering team. Passionate about best practices on code quality and performance. Ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical teams. Ability to measure the risk of choosing a new technology from the point of view of delivering the product on time and training the team. Strong work ethics and leads by example. It bothers you if your software is buggy and doesn't perform optimally.

Bonus Points: Experience with CSS Preprocessors (Sass or Less) Experience with React, Backbone or any other JavaScript frameworks a major plus. Experience giving technical mentorship and best practices training to peers. Deep understanding of Agile software development lifecycle. Interest and/or love of K-12 education.
subjects: Computer Programming, Computer Science, Web Development, Programming Languages, Personal Transformation, Data & Analytics, Project Management, Databases, Software Testing, Communications, Web Design, Software Engineering, Leadership, Management, Marketing Fundamentals, Productivity, Media, Search Engine Optimization, Production, Analytics & Automation, Architectural Design, Other Programming, Product Marketing, Instructional Design

name: Experienced Web Developers
desc:
Loco2's mission is to make booking trains anywhere in Europe as easy and affordable as possible, from epic international adventures to everyday local commutes. Our booking coverage is unrivalled and growing.

We’re hiring two experienced web developers to join our existing team of six, where you’ll help rebuild the front-end of our website into a modern single-page application using React. We know React is a new technology, and we’re willing to consider anyone with demonstrable JavaScript experience and a desire to learn and grow.

At Loco2 we care deeply about building an inclusive, open and supportive work environment. We behave with respect for people and the planet and are seeking a diverse range of candidates that share these values.

About us

We're a small, passionate and cosmopolitan team, with a healthy remote-first culture and an office based in London. Our success is built on trust, empathy and shared knowledge, with our users at the centre of what we do. We're proud to have an average rating of 9.3 out of 10 on Trustpilot after 22,000 reviews.

We’ve been selling tickets since 2012 (read our full story here), and we’re growing rapidly as the business matures. Our goal is to scale effectively whilst continuing to delight our users.

Why join us?

  • We have high codings standards, and follow best practices such as continuous testing and delivery
  • We strive to learn and improve together in a supportive environment as the wider tech ecosystem evolves
  • Our team enjoys a healthy work-life balance and don’t think caffeine-fuelled all-nighters are a good way to grow a company that’s built to last
  • We offer flexible hours and a well-designed remote working culture built on trust. Work around your schedule and when you’re most productive
  • Our days are not full of meetings and needless distractions, allowing others to achieve flow is a big part of supporting each other
  • Everyone is encouraged to ask questions, think creatively and suggest new working practices, we have a small team so your voice will be heard
  • You will be provided with a laptop and are empowered to make changes that improve your working environment

Tech stack and role description

We’re transitioning our traditional multi-page application to a React-powered single-page application so our customers can enjoy a fast, reliable and consistent experience across all of their devices.

This role is focused on that challenge, working with experienced members of our existing team to help us separate concerns and scale effectively without succumbing to the potential pitfalls of a microservices approach.

The new front-end will use modern technologies, including React, TypeScript, Redux and modular CSS. We know React is a new technology, and we’re willing to consider anyone with demonstrable JavaScript experience and a desire to learn and grow, with Ruby experience as a nice-to-have.

Whilst we don’t expect you to be a master of the following technologies, our current software stack consists of:

  • A Ruby library for communicating with train booking APIs
  • A traditional multi-page web application written in Ruby on Rails, using CoffeeScript and SCSS
  • AWS hosted Docker infrastructure, with continuous delivery
  • A hybrid iOS app written in Swift
  • A hybrid Android app written in Kotlin

About you

An ideal candidate:

  • Has 3+ years of professional web development experience
  • Deep knowledge and experience of JavaScript, HTML and CSS, and ideally Ruby (or a similar server-side language)
  • Is excited about the future of the web platform, the ever evolving JavaScript ecosystem and is motivated to help Loco2 adopt modern front-end technologies and processes
  • Takes pride in their craft and adheres to industry best practices such as testing, code linting, peer review and clean modular maintainable code
  • Has a keen appetite appetite for self-improvement and growth, but doesn't hesitate to ask for help when needed
  • Strives to discover and understand the root cause of problems, suggesting new and improved solutions, rather than treating the symptoms
  • Is fluent in English and confident communicating and sharing complex information and learnings with both technical and non-technical team members
  • Can work hours that have some overlap with London daytime
  • Is motivated by Loco2's mission
subjects: Web Development, Software Testing, Communications, Web Design, User Experience, Creativity, Motivation, Productivity, Production, English, Other Programming, Industry, Design Thinking

name: Software Developer (Functional Programming)
desc:
Software Developer

Jane Street is a proprietary quantitative trading firm, focusing primarily on trading equities and equity derivatives. We use innovative technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to stay successful in our highly competitive field. We operate around the clock and around the globe, employing over 500 people in offices in New York, London and Hong Kong.

The markets in which we trade change rapidly, but our intellectual approach changes faster still. Every day, we have new problems to solve and new theories to test. Our entrepreneurial culture is driven by our talented team of traders and programmers. At Jane Street, we don't come to work wanting to leave. We come to work excited to test new theories, have thought-provoking discussions, and maybe sneak in a game of ping-pong or two. Keeping our culture casual and our employees happy is of paramount importance to us.

We are looking to hire great software developers with an interest in functional programming. OCaml, a statically typed functional programming language with similarities to Haskell, Scheme, Erlang, F# and SML, is our language of choice. We've got the largest team of OCaml developers in any industrial setting, and probably the world's largest OCaml codebase. We use OCaml for running our entire business, supporting everything from research to systems administration to trading systems. If you're interested in seeing how functional programming plays out in the real world, there's no better place.

The atmosphere is informal and intellectual. There is a focus on education, and people learn about software and trading, both through formal classes and on the job. The work is challenging, and you get to see the practical impact of your efforts in quick and dramatic terms. Jane Street is also small enough that people have the freedom to get involved in many different areas of the business. Compensation is highly competitive, and there's a lot of room for growth.

You can learn more about Jane Street and our technology from our main site, janestreet.com. You can also look at a a talk given at CMU about why Jane Street uses functional programming (http://ocaml.janestreet.com/?q=node/61), and our programming blog (http://ocaml.janestreet.com).

We also have extensive benefits, including:

  • 90% book reimbursement for work-related books
  • 90% tuition reimbursement for continuing education
  • Excellent, zero-premium medical and dental insurance
  • Free lunch delivered daily from a selection of restaurants
  • Catered breakfasts and fresh brewed Peet's coffee
  • An on-site, private gym in New York with towel service
  • Kitchens fully stocked with a variety of snack choices
  • Full company 401(k) match up to 6% of salary, vests immediately

More information at http://janestreet.com/culture/benefits/
subjects: Probability, Programming Languages, Operating Systems, Software Testing, Game Development, Operations, Other Programming, Happiness, Gaming, Industry

name: Senior Node.js Engineer
desc:
Do you want to make a difference at a world-class software startup? Help us move fast and solve interesting problems as we build highly available systems powering a successful business with a team of smart and motivated cross-functional engineers.  

At GasBuddy, we take pride in helping people by building innovative, comprehensive products for millions of gas station owners, fuel retailers and drivers on the road every day - and our world-class team is always up to the challenge. GasBuddy is a place that empowers employees to grow, build and thrive. Whether we’re releasing a new app feature or competing in ping pong tournaments, you’ll be a part of a team that puts in 110%.

GasBuddy is looking for a Senior Node.js Engineer to join us and lead the development and launch of new GasBuddy products on our consumer web properties. You will contribute towards the development of web properties, micro-services, and internal tools. This is a small team that takes pride in their work and implements creative solutions.

What You'll Do

  • Work directly on gasbuddy.com and relevant web properties
  • Opportunity to lead/mentor junior members of the team
  • Collaborate with engineering and systems teams to deliver end-to-end solutions
  • Encourage best practices for the web

What We Seek:

  • Strong ability with Node.js and modern frontend JavaScript frameworks (React strongly preferred) - BA/BS or equivalent work experience
  • 3+ years of full-stack web development
  • Professional experience with PostgreSQL or similar
  • Experience with RESTful services
  • Data-informed product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, startup environment
  • Understanding of SEO methodologies
  • Experience with universal/isomorphic React
  • Experience with building microservices
  • Experience with agile methodologies
  • Experience with accessibility standards

GasBuddy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Hiring and other employment decisions at GasBuddy are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, ancestry, national origin, ethnic origin, age, disability, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation, record of offenses, marital status, family status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law, regulation, or ordinance.

name: Senior Backend Developer (PHP)
desc:
You are a technically curious Backend PHP Developer that wants to be part of a core development product team. You do understand (and maybe even already have experience with) the power of things like TDD, DDD, CQRS ? Then apply for the position of Senior Backend Developer (PHP) at VONQ and be part of our team that builds our flagship product, tools and APIs that serve global customers! #gettingthingsdoneright

Senior Backend Developer (PHP)
Rotterdam, fulltime position (32 - 40), starting ASAP

Description
As a Senior Backend Developer in the VONQ Product Team, you will be leading critical product development efforts and get your hands dirty in the implementation of various applications/services. You'll be working closely with our CTO and our product management team.

You will be contributing to our flagship product called Job Marketing Platform (JMP). It’s a (big) data-driven application with a recommendation engine to serve multiple personas. JMP incorporates the team’s learnings and best practices including CQRS and event sourcing. Although it’s a young product we’re practicing LEAN methodology to gradually evolve it in a modular way and having a very ambitious roadmap in mind.

What you actually will do

Work in an agile (scrum) environment and deliver high quality applications/services Pro-actively lead development efforts for new product initiatives and feature development Mentor and support team members Support the devops team in utilizing practices such as CI, CD, and automated release management Write robust and efficient code primarily using PHP, Symfony and MySQL, and learn other languages/frameworks if needed

Which boxes do you tick?
(Psst...You do not need to tick all the boxes below in order to apply...) This describes the ideal candidate, but above all we value people that have an appetite to excel, and the potential to succeed.

What we need

  • Bachelor degree or equivalent relevant work experience
  • Creating high quality multi-tiered applications primarily preferably with PHP and MySQL
  • Experience with Symfony2 and Domain Driven Design
  • Experience in contributing to the systems and software architecture of a company
  • Experience leading team development efforts to implement new product initiatives and features
  • Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum / Kanban)
  • Experience with practices such as TDD, CI and CD
  • Experience with automated testing using tools such as PHPUnit, PHPSpec and Behat
  • Excellent communication skills in English
  • An Agile mindset: being able and willing to cross roles and specialities to make the team succeed

Bonus points

  • Experience with devops and infrastructure practices and technology like deployment automation, provisioning etc. in a safe, reliable way
  • Understanding of design patterns such as event sourcing and CQRS, and you know when to apply them
  • Experience with REST API design
  • Experience with Elasticsearch
  • Worked as part of a distributed (or international) team
  • Enthusiasm to bring new ideas and share your knowledge with the team

Things we cherish

  • Business-centric thinking, and a goal driven personality
  • Entrepreneurial spirit
  • Technical curiosity, critically open to new tools and technologies
  • Passion for creating an elegant systems architecture
  • Lame jokes (what can I say...) & beer on Fridays and often BBQs at our terrace ;-)

What’s in it for you
First of all, you’ll be working with experienced colleagues with a strong vision on web development and software architecture, giving you a full intellectual challenge every day. Secondly you will be part of a vibrant and ambitious team of 12 different nationalities in a very casual environment. Thirdly, you'll have the opportunity to participate in meetups/conferences.

We often have a BBQ (and beers) on our terrace at the office and multicultural potluck lunches. Oh.. and you will have fun!

What’s more

  • Laptop of your preferences and two extra screens on your desk
  • Flexible working hours
  • Time and budget for training
  • 5 weeks paid holiday per year
  • Good salary and additional incentives
  • Fixed term contract with an option for perm
  • Support with relocating

So, does this sounds appealing to you?
Please apply by clicking on the link

Click here to apply!!

If you have any questions, please send an email to Sarah (Recruiter) -> sarahellithy@vonq.com.

Agencies hold your horses: unsolicited CV’s are dropped by our SPAM filters.

name: Front-end Developer - London
desc:
At Workshare, we are looking for a great JavaScript developer who is proficient with React. to join our development team in London.

We are in the process of rebuilding the front-end of our Transact product. Transact helps law firms around the world manage complex multi-party transactions. This secure web application helps users to be more productive in a world where long, complex documents and the detail within them flow and change over time. We make a difference to their world as we deliver software using agile techniques, modern web frameworks, TDD and continuous delivery. We write code and tests, review the pull request and ship it to production; and we do so many times a day!

In our culture, we encourage and care about learning new things, the quality of our code, good practices and software design.

You will be

  • Developing new user-facing features using React.js
  • Building reusable components and front-end libraries
  • Translating designs and wireframes into high-quality code
  • Writing unit tests for your code
  • As you grow, mentoring other developers

You have

  • Strong proficiency in JavaScript, DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
  • Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles like functional programming
  • Experience with popular React.js and related libraries (such as Flux or Redux)
  • Familiarity with newer specifications of ECMAScript
  • Follow best practices like TDD, single responsibility principle, etc.
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs
  • Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, and familiarity with security-related concepts like XSS and CSRF tokens.
  • Experience with common front-end development tools such as Webpack, NPM, etc.
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
  • Familiarity with code versioning in Git
  • Experience with Semantic UI
  • Experience with Jest
  • Knowledge of LESS/Sass
  • Back-end skills in either Ruby, Elixir, .Net or Java will be a plus

Benefits

  • Tribes and squads model
  • Actively building and practising Continuous Delivery
  • Modern software development technologies like React, Elixir and Node
  • Work from home once a week if practical
  • Up to 28 days’ holiday per year (plus 8 days’ bank holiday)
  • Subsidised Gym Membership
  • Free tea, coffee, fruit and treats throughout the week
  • Quarterly events in the office
  • Ideally situated close to Liverpool Street and Spitalfields Market

name: TECHNICAL PRODUCT LEAD
desc:
DESCRIPTION: Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead to join our worldwide team. Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps.

You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about the client’s concerns as well as a colleague’s concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging.

Our technical product leaders spend much of their time in the code. Develop world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world. 75% of your time leading the technical strategy in the code; 25% of your time in meetings organizing and unlocking the other devs

You set the mood on the team. Not only internally but also with our clients. You get excited about getting the best out of team member and have demonstrated successful product launches.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 7+ years of experience in software development teams. New tools are great, but fundamentals of data structures, design patterns, and programming practices are what deliver projects.

  • Has led a product meeting that has technical implications with Fortune 500 executives sitting around a conference room table

  • Deep knowledge of Javascript and language agnostic as we utilize other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go, C# and on occasion Java or C++ .

  • Well qualified applicants will have deep experiences in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities.

  • Excellent self-starter who collaborates effectively with all stakeholders, and has the ability to work in a fast-paced team.

BENEFITS:

Own Your Time We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself You’ll receive a health/wellness stipend that can go towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance, or joining a gym!

Focused Work You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your Edges We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out https://youtu.be/KwOz-y4uuWk

name: C++ Software Developer
desc:
As a C++ Platform Developer in out Ads tech team you will be working with cutting edge mobile ads technologies and create the next generation of our Ads Platform. A Platform developer is expected to:

  • Design, architect and implement features required to support business functionality
  • Ensure high performance, reliability, scalability and security of our systems
  • Deliver code (and supporting documentation) of the highest quality through good design, attention to detail and system testing on a timely basis
  • Share knowledge and help colleagues both inside and outside of your team

YOUR ROLE

You have a strong passion for building mobile technologies in a native environment. You're an excellent communicator, happy to work with people from several different business units. You can translate business needs into technical requirements and implementation. You're excited about doing what's best for the team, and adaptable enough to work on different things as projects evolve.

SKILLS TO CREATE THRILLS

  • Strong C++ experience
  • Strong experience with mobile platforms and development
  • Testing frameworks and integration tests
  • Care for code quality

BONUS SKILLS

  • Objective C
  • Java

A GREAT SAGA NEEDS ALL SORT OF HEROES

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.

WE’RE SERIOUSLY PLAYFUL

Officially, we’re a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. Unofficially, we’re a serious business that’s not afraid to have fun. Every day at King, we mix intuition with logic, art with science and magic with mathematics to create the games the world loves to play. Together with our parent company Activision Blizzard, our mission is to bring moments of magic to everyday life. If you think this is something you can help us achieve, let’s talk.

name: Full-Stack Node.js Developer for Established Ed-Tech Startup
desc:
YoyoChinese is looking for an experienced full stack Node.js developer to join our company as tech-lead and help us with the ongoing maintenance and future development of our interactive Chinese language learning web app, Yoyo Chinese. (https://www.yoyochinese.com)

Yoyo Chinese helps thousands of language learners around the world learn Mandarin using hundreds of video lessons and other interactive learning tools like flashcards, quizzes, and progress tracking.

Our site is built in Node.js and we're looking for a full-time (or close to full-time) developer who can join our team and is capable of taking over our existing code and maintaining what we've already built (general site maintenance and squashing bugs) as well as helping us continue to develop and improve the app into the future with updates and new features as the company grows.

You'll work directly with our product and project managers as a Yoyo team member. We're also beginning development on a mobile app and you'll work directly with our mobile developers to help ensure the Yoyo Chinese experience is seamless across all platforms.

We'd like to find a developer who believes in our mission of teaching the world Chinese and is looking for a long-term relationship with our company. You must have proven experience as a qualified Node.js developer and excellent English communication and project management skills.

We’re located in LA county, but your time zone and working location are flexible and can be discussed.

Responsibilities

  • Maintaining the daily operation of our website, yoyochinese.com
  • Improving existing website features and helping with the development of new ones
  • General code optimization and refactoring
  • Development work includes both front-end and back-end, as well as database development.
  • Ongoing maintenance and improvement of the general performance and stability of the website
  • Working with mobile development team to help turn our web-app into a 5-star mobile app on both iOS and Android platforms, launching both apps simultaneously

Qualifications

  • At least 2 years of Node.js full-stack development, having participated in the development of - 2 products with ample experience with iterative development.
  • Proficient in Node.js server-side frameworks
  • Proficient in basic HTML5/Javascript/CSS3/Ajax
  • Proficient in Express + Jade framework, with relevant development experience using similar technology.
  • Familiar with CSS Front end UI framework such as BootStrap/LESS/SASS, etc.
  • Can be independently in charge of planning, designing and executing MySQL database
  • Experience with and Agile Scrum development
  • Good coding practices, using clean and tidy code with a high level of maintainability.
  • Strong ability to drive requirement analysis
  • A good sense of team spirit and collaboration, in addition to good communication skills with a desire to learn.
  • Good self-management skills and an ability to work independently on tasks in a successful and efficient manner.

name: Infrastructure Engineer Lead
desc:
Orion Labs is dedicated to revolutionizing the way that people communicate. Our heads-up, wearable-enabled voice communication service helps people to stay connected across any distance and to collaborate more effectively.

Orion Labs was founded by people who helped to shape the DevOps movement, and we are proud to continue in that tradition. Our products run on a high-availability, microservices-oriented platform, which supports a variety of voice-streaming clients and integrations.

We're looking for an experienced engineer to join our team as Infrastructure Lead!

About you: You have years of hard-won experience building and operating robust cloud-based web services infrastructure. You instrument and monitor everything you possibly can. You automate everything to keep from being woken up in the middle of the night. You love collaborating to design and implement elegant systems, but you're also ready to roll up your sleeves and get the job done. You know how to mentor and empower other engineers to succeed at their work. You've led an engineering team before, or you're a strong senior engineer ready to make the leap. You are eager to learn!

About us: Our stack is implemented on AWS in a mix of Python and Go. We treat infrastructure as code, provisioning everything with Terraform and Chef, and we're starting to use Docker. We believe that Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment mitigates risk, and you should too. We think of "DevOps" both as a kind of culture, and as a pattern for rapid change. We value confidence, humility, engagement, inclusiveness, consensus, and mutual trust.

We don't need you to be an expert in any particular technology -- we expect you to have a variety of tools in your kit, and the thoughtfulness to weigh trade-offs and apply each one wisely.

We have a lot of interesting problems to solve as we continue to grow and scale out! As Infrastructure Lead, you'll help us design the future of the Orion Platform, and then enable your team to collaborate with others to build it.

Come join us on this adventure! (And send us a link to your public Github profile, if you have one!)

Orion is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive team with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences. This means striving to hire a diverse set of humans and providing them with support, mentorship, and opportunities to grow. We firmly believe that hiring and supporting a diverse team is valuable endeavor in itself, and also allows us to do our best work and make better products. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, ability status, or any other differences. All are welcome here.

Trans Can Work certified employer, 2017
subjects: Operating Systems, Communications, Web Design, Productivity, Religion & Spirituality, Design Tools, Instruments, Production, Operations, Humanities, Design Thinking

name: Full Stack Developer
desc:
Booking.com is looking for Full Stack Developers all around the globe! Join us in our beautiful Amsterdam headquarters and work on planet Earth’s #1 accommodation website with the industry’s smartest people! Our guiding principle is that by helping users we help our business

B.Responsible

As a Full Stack Developer, you are responsible for developing world-class, complete web applications, both on the backend and frontend, for monitoring and addressing performance and security, and for developing customer-focused and scalable user experiences. You will work side-by-side with designers, product owners, copywriters and other developers to create new features, test your own ideas, and push changes live for billions of users. You will:

Deliver web applications from an idea inception and validation to a scalable solution. Collaborate with colleagues to ideate solutions for users, prioritizing based on business impact, and A/B test them. Develop new user-facing products and optimize existing ones using both client-side as well as server-side languages and technologies

B.Skilled

Understanding the full stack of web development, from transmission of data segments between networks to presenting a well-strategized experience to users is vitally important in this role. We need self-starters who are great at solving problems, who initiate discussions, are solutions-oriented, customer focused and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools. We are looking for:

  • Experience working on products that impact a large user base or in an entrepreneurial startup environment.
  • Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc.
  • Self-starters with a collaborative, “can-do” attitude.
  • Quick delivery of end-to-end solutions to validate ideas and produce quality products
  • A minimum of 3 years of experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Perl, Java, Python, Scala, C++ and Web development with JavaScript, HTML, CSS and HTTP.
  • Experience debugging cross-browser compatibility issues.
  • Experience working on a command line in a Linux environment.
  • Passionate learners who aren’t afraid of new tools and technologies to build a great end-to-end customer experience.

B.Offered

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential. We offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits. We have tech talks, trainings, and support you attending and speaking at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and, in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam. We successfully relocate hundreds of IT professionals and their families to Amsterdam every year. Join us!

The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for a Full Stack Developer in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to “Booking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

name: Sr. Linux Systems Engineer
desc:
Sr. Linux Systems Engineer

We are currently seeking a Sr. Linux Systems Engineer. This role works with the IT Director and other IT staff to engineer, implement, maintain and support the information technology server and network infrastructure. This role administers and maintains servers, networks, and associated services. Keeps services in full working order, as directed by the IT Director. Implements and maintains various other software, hardware and documentation.

Requirements
There will be other Job Duties and Responsibilties in addition the ones listed below:

  • Help install, maintain, diagnose and repair our systems and servers
  • Monitor and maintain our global network
  • Implement/maintain monitoring and recovery tools and procedures
  • Install and configure infrastructure devices such as network switches and firewalls
  • Assist tech support with complex server image conversions and other support issues
  • Assist sales with complex customer requirements
  • Manage and maintain company firewalls and other security tools
  • Work with external suppliers, such as ISPs to resolve service issues
  • Recommend and implement changes in procedures that improve security and reliability of our systems
  • Develop and maintain documentation, including SOPs and diagrams
  • Must work well in teams or alone and be proactive
  • Some after hours or on-call occasionally required


Skills:

  • At least 7 years´ experience as a Systems Engineer
  • Experience with multi-site environments
  • Expert level Linux (Ubuntu) skills. This is a must
  • Proficiency with networking and firewalls
  • Ability to write scripts to automate tasks
  • Experience with automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet or Chef

  • Familiarity with security principles and tools such as Kali Linux
  • Good working knowledge of DNS, DHCP, LDAP, SMTP, FTP, sFTP, TCP/IP, SSH, Samba, Apache

Are you up for the challenge?
Apply now via the application form.

name: PHP Back-End Developer
desc:
VKS is seeking a talented, passionate, roll-up-your-sleeves, hands-on, highly independent PHP Developer.

As a Back-End Developer, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining robust back-end services. Our team works at a fast pace on an awesome product that is constantly evolving and improving so we're looking for someone who can pick things up quickly. Your job will be dynamic, interesting and challenging. We have a passionate and dedicated team, and offer a respectful and healthy work environment.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain clean, efficient, secure, and well-engineered back-end code that conforms with accepted standards.

Produce detailed specifications for each new feature or enhancement.

Communicate and collaborate effectively with team members.

Proactively identify opportunities for process and software improvements and make constructive suggestions for change.

Identify new technologies that can improve product development and the user experience. Work closely with databases.

Build and maintain unit tests.

Design and create web services for front-end use and integration with other systems.

Ensure that customer issues and technology failures are detected, isolated, and resolved rapidly, and prevented from happening again.

Create and adhere to timelines for multiple projects and stakeholders

Skills & Requirements:

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

3+ years experience developing rich, large-scale web applications

Expert level coding skills in PHP.

Experience with many modern back-end technologies, such as Symfony (versions 1.x to 4.x), Lavarel, Zend, CakePHP, etc..

Strong database skills and experience with MySQL.

Experience with XML, Web Services and REST.

Strong Linux experience (the software currently runs on CentOS and Red Hat).

Experience in writing functional specifications.

Experience with GitHub or an equivalent source management system.

Significant web design experience taking projects from concept to code to market.

Experience with collaboration tools like Google Docs and Jira.

Experience building multilingual applications.

Have detail-oriented and strong problem-solving skills.

Ability to work independently while participating actively in an Agile/SCRUM environment.

Strong organization skills, self-motivated, team player, multi-tasking capability.

You are satisfied only when things are perfect.

Preference given to bilingual (English and French, spoken and written) candidates.

It's a plus if you also have experience with… Docker Jenkins ElasticSearch The concept of micro services Position​: Permanent

Start date: As soon as possible

Indemnities: To be discussed

Work schedule: 40 hours/week, flexible

name: Head of Engineering
desc:
We're looking for a Head of Engineering to lead our growing engineer team who is excited about leading engineering efforts for a system that will transform how user data will be managed for every consumer app across the web.

Someone who is a seasoned professional who has ideally worked in both small scrappy teams, as well as larger structured team. Someone who is capable of solving complex computer science problems and not afraid to roll up their sleeves.

About You:

Effective team builder: not your first rodeo. You know how to effectively build a world-class engineering team, and do not need a Facebook budget to do it.

Well versed with API's: you're an expert at understanding and writing API's, and enjoy creating maintainable and scalable systems.

Excellent communication skills: ability to effectively manage communication between engineers, stakeholders, and product teams in a remote capacity.

Multi-task: you're able to effectively manage and lead multiple projects.

Adaptable: ability to adjust and stay agile while scaling an organization.

Blockchain: Blockchain, Solidity Smart Contracts, IPFS: the more experience the better.

Benefits:

Token package: you will receive tokens as a part of your comp package. If you're familiar with blockchain you know this is 10x better than stock options.

Remote: we are headquartered in San Francisco, but the majority of our team is remote. Whether in SF or not, you will have the opportunity to work the majority of your week in a remote capacity.

Following: dock.io has one of the largest and fastest growing communities in crypto, as well as an "alpha" app, which is growing by more than 3,000 new registered users per day.

name: EOI - Functional Programming Software Engineers
desc:
• Are you passionate about functional programming?
  • We seek 5 new engineers of various experience levels
  • Join Data61's Queensland Functional Programming Lab

The Position

Data61 is the largest technology innovation group in Australia. Bringing together CSIRO’s Productivity team and National ICT Australia (NICTA), we are unrivalled in our intellectual capital and our network with the global technology marketplace.

We are currently seeking Functional Programming Software Engineers to fill five vacancies. These roles span early-career through to senior software engineer roles. In these roles, you will develop open-source software using functional programming with an emphasis on application to industry problems. The positions will be based in Data61’s Engineering & Design Group with allocation to our Queensland Functional Programming Lab.

We require developers with a diversity of skills in programming, particularly in industry application, and with a strong desire to improve quality of software through functional programming. Early-career Functional Programmers, with aspirations to take advantage of the technical benefits of functional programming, are encouraged to apply. A commitment to self-directed learning is essential for this role.

In this role you will:

  • Develop software systems using functional programming techniques.
  • Work collaboratively with project team members including project leaders, engineers and researchers.
  • Make use of functional programming tools and processes for efficiency of software development and ensuring software quality.
  • Contribute to open source projects.
  • Contribute to Data61’s engineering discipline by participating in discussions of software development tools, processes and culture.
  • Maintain high ethical and performance standards.

Location: Brisbane, QLD Salary: Various, to reflect early-career through to senior level Tenure: 5 positions, specified term of up to 3 years. Ref No.: 56235

To be successful you will need:

  • An ability to demonstrate functional programming principles using programming languages such as Haskell, Purescript or Idris.
  • Self-directed and motivated learner, who seeks out knowledge by own volition.
  • Experience with revision control systems such as git, darcs or mercurial.
  • An understanding and commitment to principles of open-source software.
  • Willingness to comply with company Equal Opportunity and Occupational Health and Safety policies.

Desirable Technical Expertise:

  • Skills in front-end development, preferably using languages such as Haskell or Purescript.
  • Skills and experience in compiler theory and programming language design.
  • Skills in creating or improving language tooling and library documentation.
  • Experience with existing machine learning programming tools and a desire to improve on those.
  • Experience with programming in an industry setting and familiarity with its typical challenges.

We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate. At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today – for our customers, all Australians and the world. We do this by using science and technology to solve real issues. Diversity is the compass that navigates our innovation. We provide an inclusive workplace that respects, values and actively pursues the benefits of a diverse workforce.

We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Find out more! CSIRO Balance

How to apply:

To register your interest you will be required to submit your resume and cover letter, as one document, highlighting your experience as relevant to the role requirements. Please apply via https://jobs.csiro.au/job/Brisbane%2C-QLD-EOI-Functional-Programming-Software-Engineers/463348700/

name: JUNIORA INGENJÖRER INOM MJUKVARUUTVECKLING OCH/ELLER TEST TILL REJLERS
desc:
Rejlers söker Juniora testingenjörer och utvecklingsingenjörer inom mjukvara till olika projekt i Storstockholm. I denna roll erbjuds du många verktyg till att få en raketstart på din karriär. Till exempel ges du möjligheten till kompetensutveckling, löpande coachning med din konsultchef samt arbete och lärande från seniora kollegor. Var en del i en organisation som värdesätter varje medarbetare, sök tjänsten redan idag!

OM TJÄNSTEN

Rejlers är ett av Nordens största teknikkonsultbolag som arbetar med projekt och IT-lösningar inom bygg och fastighet, energi, industri och infrastruktur. I den här tjänsten kommer du ges möjlighet till stor individuell utveckling i en prestigelös företagskultur som präglas av en social miljö med korta beslutsvägar. Du kommer få en gedigen introduktion och bra förutsättningar för att snabbt komma upp på banan i din nya roll.

I denna roll kan du bli erbjuden:

  • En förberedande kurs inom populära agila ramverket SCRUM inför certifiering som titulerar dig som Professional Scrum Master (PSM 1)
  • Full access till e-learning biblioteket Pluralsight med tillgång till över 6300 kurser inom IT & Tech
  • Kompetensutveckling i form av en fysisk lärarledd kurs via Cornerstone, Addskills eller Global
  • Knowledge
  • Coachtillfällen med konsultchef
  • Möjlighet att delta i konsultträffar för nätverk och erfarenhetsutbyte
  • Detta är ett konsultuppdrag. Du kommer vara anställd av Academic Work och arbeta som konsult hos Rejlers. Uppdraget kommer att vara på heltid och sträcka sig minst 6 månader framåt. Det finns goda möjligheter att bli förlängd på uppdraget, förutsatt att alla parter är nöjda med samarbetet.

ARBETSUPPGIFTER

I rollen som ingenjör inom mjukvaruutveckling och/ eller test kommer du i huvudsak att arbeta i projektform ute hos Rejlers kunder. Uppdragen kan skilja sig åt beroende på vad kunden efterfrågar för det specifika projektet.

Som testingenjör kommer du arbeta nära utvecklingsavdelningen med kvalitetssäkring och test av inbyggda system.

I rollen som utvecklingsingenjör kommer du främst att arbeta inom programmering i något av följande språk: C, C++, C#/.Net, XML, SQL, Python. Du behöver inte nödvändigtvis vara fullärd i något av just dessa programmeringsspråk idag. Dock ser vi gärna att du är en driven programmerare som gärna jobbar med något eller några av dessa språk.

VI SÖKER DIG SOM

  • Har en teknisk utbildning inom elektroteknik, datateknik eller motsvarande på universitet/högskolenivå eller från relevant YH-utbildning
  • Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift

Det är meriterande om du:

  • Har erfarenhet i utveckling av inbyggda system och/eller test av inbyggda system
  • Har erfarenhet av fordonskommunikation
  • Har erfarenhet från utbildning/tidigare arbete inom programmering i något av följande språk C, C++, C#, .net, XML, SQL, Python.
  • Har erfarenhet inom UX och Webbdesign
  • Som person är du handlingskraftig och ansvarstagande. Du tycker om att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp samtidigt som du har en god kommunikativ förmåga.

ÖVRIG INFORMATION

  • Start: Omgående

  • Omfattning: Heltid, 6 månader med chans till förlängning

  • Placering: Storstockholm

  • Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Rejlers önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work.

  • Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på länken under "How to apply". Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.

  • Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail men har du specifika frågor kring tjänsten besvaras dessa på stw01@academicwork.se under kontorstid. Skriv annonstiteln i rubriken och kopiera gärna in länken till annonsen i ditt mail. För generella funderingar kring din ansökan/vår rekryteringsprocess finns vi ofta tillgängliga i chatten på vår webb under vardagar så hör gärna av dig där!

SKYDD FÖR DEN PERSONLIGA INTEGRITETEN

När du skickar in din ansökan till Academic Work godkänner och samtycker du till att Academic Work behandlar dina personuppgifter enligt Personuppgiftslagen. Läs mer under vår PuL-sida: https://www.academicwork.se/pul

OM OSS

Academic Work är Home of the young professionals. Det betyder att de flesta av våra jobb är relevanta för dig som studerar på högskola/universitet eller för dig som är klar med dina studier och är i början av din karriär. Hos oss kan du arbeta som konsult på uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, bli anställd direkt hos ett kundföretag via vår rekryteringsverksamhet eller börja jobba internt på något av våra Academic Work kontor. Läs mer på www.academicwork.se.

  • Vi strävar efter att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare till våra konsulter. Utöver kollektivavtalsenliga villkor och dedikerad konsultchef erbjuder vi dig som heltidskonsult en konsultportal med förmånliga erbjudanden. Läs mer här: https://www.academicwork.se/vart-erbjudande-till-heltidskonsulter

INFORMATION OM FÖRETAGET

Rejlers är ett av Nordens största teknikkonsultbolag med 2000 experter som arbetar med projekt och IT-lösningar inom bygg och fastighet, energi, industri och infrastruktur. De arbetar med allt ifrån förstudier och planering till design, konstruktion, projektering och projektledning och finns på ca 80 orter i Sverige, Finland och Norge.

name: Director, Software R&D
desc:
Director, Software R&D(Job Number: 3808180220)

Description: Johnson & Johnson Vision Surgical, part of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for a Director, Software - R&D to be located in Milpitas, Ca or Santa Ana, Ca . Johnson & Johnson Vision Surgical ("JJVS") is focused on the discovery, development and commercialization of medical devices for cataract and refractive surgery. As a global cataract leader, JJVS provides intraocular lenses (both monofocal reimbursed and premium IOLs) that are specially designed to provide optimized visual outcomes, phacoemulsification and femtosecond laser equipment to safely and efficiently remove cataracts and a full offering of surgical adjuncts, including sterile viscosurgical devices/solutions.

JJVS is the global market leader in the presbyopia correcting IOL marketplace and holds strong #2 positions in all other cataract surgery markets in which it competes. JJVS is also the global market leader in laser refractive surgery and provides excimer and femtosecond lasers and advanced diagnostic devices for corneal refractive surgery. JJVS provides its products in more than 150 countries (more than 60 with a direct sales presence) worldwide.

The Director, Software - R&D, will be responsible for leadership and management of software R&D personnel.

The Director, Software - R&D will:

  • Direct the planning and execution of software development and technical support for J&J Vision's equipment product lines, which currently includes femtosecond lasers, excimer lasers, integrated aberrometer/topographer diagnostic systems, phacoemulsification devices, dry eye diagnostic and treatment systems, apps and websites.

  • Assure compliance of all software and software- related activities with J&J, government, quality and regulatory standards, policies and procedures.

  • Address compliance with applicable Enterprise and Business Unit policies and procedures.

  • Lead and manage the development and technology transfer of software solutions for J&J Vision's current Product Portfolio includes excimer lasers, femtosecond lasers, aberrometer/topographer diagnostic systems, phacoemulsification systems, dry eye diagnostic and treatment systems and associated products.

  • Lead the development and integration of software products that meet the needs of the company's customers.

  • Provide the company with significant competitive differentiation against competitive companies and support the revenue growth requirements of the business.

  • Provide leadership and vision for a multi-site R&D software teams via the development and implementation of comprehensive software design for the lifecycle of the various product lines.

  • Lead resource allocation, budgeting, outsourcing allocation, and personnel development as it relates to software development.

  • Both directly and through subordinates, account for product development, product quality, documentation, support and packaging of software components.

  • Work closely with the various cross-functional leaders to coordinate development of software and hardware to ensure timely registration and commercialization of J&J Vision's equipment products.

  • Supervise and lead Manager and Senior Manager level software professionals.

  • Direct responsibility for software engineers, consultants and technicians.

  • Direct the development and execution of software strategies and tactical plans to ensure the development, registration and commercialization of J&J Vision's equipment products, while following internal policies and procedures and applicable US and Foreign regulatory standards and requirements.

  • Prepare, manage and direct the execution of the Software R&D operating budget.

  • Hire, train and ensure retention of high-caliber individuals within the Software R&D organization.

  • Identify, retain and direct external software consultants and consultancy firms.

Qualifications:

  • BS in Software Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent is required, advanced degree (MS or PhD) preferred.

  • 10 years of experience in the conduct and management of software and product development with at least 5 years of experience in developing software for medical devices is required.

  • Excellent technical judgement and strong leadership skills as evidenced by a succession of technical software management positions with increasing responsibility is required.

  • Experience in software development and new product commercialization in the medical device industry as demonstrated by a track record of successful development and commercialization of new products is required.

  • Experience with cybersecurity and IoT (Internet of Things) is required.

  • Familiarity with ophthalmic surgery is preferred.

  • Complete understanding of software design, development, requirements management, and verification and validation processes, including the use of state of the art tools for management thereof is required.

  • Excellent communication skills including both written and verbal in required

  • Up to 10-15% domestic travel is required.

Primary Location: North America-United States-California-Santa Ana

Other Location: North America-United States-California-Milpitas

Organization: AMO US Holdings, Inc.. (6234)

Job Function: R&D

Travel 0-10%

Apply Here: http://www.Click2Apply.net/4gm2kz3p8skqx985
